==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=帅}}

===Etymology===
Also written as {{och-l|率|to lead}}; both represent the ''s''-causative of {{och-l|律|to follow}}. Cognate with {{cog|bo|སྲིད||commander, leader}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=shuài
|c=seoi3
|h=pfs=sai
|md=só̤i
|mn=sòe
|w=2se,2sa
|mc=y
|oc=y
|ma=y
|cat=n
}}

===Definitions===
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{†}} {{lb|zh|military}} to [[command]]; to [[lead]] (and give orders to); to [[designate]]
#: {{zh-x|上 帥 士 以 人 之 所 戴，則 上下 和。|If the king '''appoints''' respected officers '''as commanders''', there will be harmony in the military.|CL|ref=Guanzi}}
# {{†}} to [[lead]]; to [[guide]]
# (to be a) [[role model]]; [[example]]
# to [[follow]]; to [[adhere]] to
#: {{zh-x|帥教|to follow guidance}}
# [[rapid]]; [[sharp]]; [[sudden]]
#: {{zh-x|帥然|suddenly, rapidly}}
#: {{zh-x|帥爾|rapidly}}
# [[commander-in-chief]]; [[marshal]]
# [[officialdom]]; [[senior]] [[official]]s
# {{lb|zh|of a person or a thing}} [[leader]]; [[guider]]; leading factor
# {{lb|zh|Xiangqi}} [[marshal]], the [[chief]] piece
# {{lb|zh|colloquial}} (''of men'') [[handsome]]; [[good-looking]]; [[hot]]
#: {{zh-x|帥呆|to be very good-looking}}
#: {{zh-x|帥哥|handsome guy}}
# {{lb|zh|colloquial}} [[elegant]]; [[beautiful]]; [[splendid]]; [[impressive]]
# {{surname|lang=zh}}
